title: Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery
description: CI/CD tools automate the building, testing, and deployment of code changes, enabling faster and more reliable software delivery with fewer manual steps.

sections.description: Complete platforms for automating builds, tests, and deployment pipelines

sections.title: Build Automation Tools
sections.description: Tools for compiling, building, and packaging software

sections.title: Deployment & Release Tools
sections.description: Specialized tools for deploying code to production and managing releases

sections.title: Testing Frameworks & Tools
sections.description: Tools for automated testing as part of the CI/CD pipeline

bestPractices: **Build once, deploy many times** to ensure the same artifact is promoted across environments
**Automate everything** including builds, tests, and deployments to reduce human error
**Test early and often** with a combination of unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
**Implement trunk-based development** with short-lived feature branches for faster integration
**Use feature flags** to deploy inactive code that can be enabled without a new deployment
**Maintain a deployment pipeline** with staging environments that mirror production
**Practice blue/green deployments** to reduce downtime and risk during releases
integrations: **Source Control** triggers builds automatically when code is pushed
**Infrastructure as Code** provisions consistent environments for testing and deployment
**Container Registries** store versioned Docker images for deployment
**Monitoring Tools** provide feedback on application performance after deployment
**Issue Tracking** links releases to resolved tickets and features
